alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Davidson, northwestern Rutherford, northeastern Williamson and west central Wilson Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bellevue, or 10 miles northwest of Franklin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Nashville, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Belle Meade, Hermitage, Bellevue, Antioch, Rural Hill, Berry Hill, Bells Bend, Natchez Trace At Highway 96 and Percy Priest Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 194 and 224. Interstate 65 between mile markers 68 and 85. Interstate 24 between mile markers 48 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
